Lord Eddard Stark, of the Winterfell estate, became renowned for his...
body:
↳  𝓉𝒽𝑒 𝒮𝓉𝒶𝓇𝓀 𝓅𝑜𝓇𝓉𝓇𝒶𝒾𝓉 𝓂𝓊𝓈𝑒𝓊𝓂 𝒶𝓃𝒹 𝓃𝒾𝓃𝑒𝓉𝑒𝑒𝓃𝓉𝒽 𝒸𝑒𝓃𝓉𝓊𝓇𝓎 𝒶𝓊

Lord Eddard Stark, of the Winterfell estate, became renowned for his paintings in the mid-nineteenth century. Famed for his portraits of close family, only a few remain, most having been destroyed or stolen during The Long Night when the estate was seized by enemy forces. Here are a few select examples of his remaining work, from left to right, top to bottom; ‘Family in Winter’, a depiction of himself and his wife, and their three eldest children around the hearth in the estate’s drawing-room; ‘Red Lady’, a portrait of his beloved wife, Lady Catelyn Stark (née Tully), what remains of their letters suggest that it was her hair that he loved most about her person; ‘Sansa and Kitten’, is a portrait of Eddard’s daughter, Sansa holding her pet kitten, Lady; An unnamed portrait, thought to depict one of Eddard’s three legitimate sons in adulthood, most art historians believe it to be his eldest, Robb, who was a decorated naval hero. Though this is not confirmed; Next is a portrait of the young Robb, Sansa, and almost hidden, Arya. Playing with one of the hunting dogs, the Stark’s of Winterfell were fond of their animals and there is much documentation of them and their personalities, this painting suggests that the dog is Robb’s puppy, Grey Wind, given their closeness; ‘Arry’, is a portrait of his youngest daughter, Arya, the portrait is named after the affectionate nickname given to her and a reference to her tom-boyish interests, Lady Arya would later go on to marry the estate’s blacksmith; the final portrait is of Brandon ‘Bran’ Stark, the second-youngest son. Bran founded the Winterfell University after some years of Professorship further north, presently the University is ranked 1st in the country.  Little is known of Lord Eddard and Lady Catelyn’s youngest son, Rickon, he disappeared in Skagos on a failed exploration mission when the ship he was aboard sank off the coast. Some evidence and reports suggest he actually survived the incident, but simply chose to remain in Skagos and settling there. Though these are not confirmed. Click for better quality.

summary:
It’s been like a month and I still can’t get over the sansan reunion? 
The genuine shock he has when she sits across from him???...
body:
It’s been like a month and I still can’t get over the sansan reunion?

The genuine shock he has when she sits across from him??? The gentle way they speak and smile??? The total happiness they have when they laugh??? The sadness under the implications of what happened??? The hand touch where she gently strokes his knuckle???? The bedroom eyes she shot him as she licked her lips to leave??? His little sigh of relief at the very end????

The rest of season 8 didn’t happen and that’s the only valid scene baby!!!!

tags: what will Jon feel like? in the books?
summary: I think Sansa has come to accept and forgive herself for whatever mistakes she made in the past, she has obviously learned and...
body: I think Sansa has come to accept and forgive herself for whatever mistakes she made in the past, she has obviously learned and grown and is becoming a political leader on her own. How do you think Jon is doing in that area? After coming back to life and the R+L=J revelation he will surely have a huge identity crisis of sorts but how do you think this would be explored in the books? I mean clearly the show didn’t give a s… about his feelings of self worth, but I just can’t imagine what it must be to find out your whole life was a lie, your father isn’t your father and all of that. Will he be relieved his mother wasn’t a whore? Of knowing her name finally? Will he feel guilty because of what this meant for the Starks specially Cat? What do you guys think?

summary: prologue: fall through heaven (straight to hell) » theonsa university au. car sex.  Theon rolled his eyes. He had thought that...
caption:
prologue: fall through heaven (straight to hell) » theonsa university au. car sex. 

Theon rolled his eyes. He had thought that as a respectable second year graduate student the partying days were behind him. In fact, Robb had said as much, a lecture given to a smirking and distinctly not hungover Jon and Theon, in the midst of his own, raging hangover after a particularly raucous welcome back party held at one of the frat houses. And in truth, Theon really was tired of the college parties, the cheap, terrible beer and the ridiculous gimmicks put on by the very worst sort at Winterfell University. Theon certainly knew how to chase a good time, but he no longer needed to wander into one of the overly large houses with the ridiculous High Valyrian letters that made no sense to him, and suck up to fucking Smalljon Umber just for some beer and a pretty girl to get his dick wet. He was twenty-four, and his sister owned a bar. Theon had learned how to have a good time away from the confines and judgment of University Row.

title: Queen in the North
body:
Written for Day 6 of @jonsadreamofspring based on the prompt “King and Queen”

Sansa Stark has always dreamed about being crowned Queen, but she always thought it would be alongside a King. But, even behind the strongest woman stands a happy man. Punishment or not.

Canon Divergent 

Sansa took a deep breath before she straightened her back and lifted her chin.

All her life she had dreamed about this moment, about being crowned Queen. She had envisioned herself wearing an expensive and beautiful dress reaching the floor and covering her feet. She had imagined everyone staring at her while she walked down the aisle to the front of the throne room. And she had always thought a handsome man would walk next to her, about to be crowned king.

And here she was, wearing the most beautiful gown she had ever seen, decorated with all those details symbolising all the people she had lost and everything she had been through to get here. The entire North had gathered to watch her walking across the great hall to the very front where her new throne would be standing. But the handsome man she had wanted at her side wouldn’t walk next to her.

She had tried to talk him into it. She had tried to convince him no one cared. She had begged him to just ignore whatever punishment he had gotten for doing the right thing and saving so many people from an agonising death.

But he had not given in. “I’m done fighting.” He would have looked good with a crown on his curls. “We’re already taking a big risk. Let’s not overplay our hands.” And the uniform she had had in mind for him would have fitted him perfectly. “You don’t need a King to rule this kingdom with you, Sansa.” They would have been the power couple the North deserved to reclaim the greatness so many had tried to take from them. “You’re the only ruler this kingdom needs.”

The slowly warming air carried a certain tension and Sansa felt a shiver rolling down her spine while the wooden doors were opened wide.

The last time she had seen so many people in the great hall they had prepared for battle, they had prepared to get their King back from King’s landing and they had prepared to fight anyone who would be standing between them and their goal. Unsullied. Dothraki. A fire breathing dragon. It hadn’t mattered. No one could take the King in the North from them. No one could harm him. Not without enraging the Northerners and not without paying the ultimate price for it.

Her eyes searched for familiar faces in the crowd, but most of the people she had wanted to be here were gone.

Her father was dead, beheaded on Joffrey’s orders when she had still been a child. Her mother and Robb were murdered, slaughtered at a wedding in the most brutal and horrible way possible. Rickon was killed, used as bait in a battle he could never survive. Theon died fighting in the Godswood, where they had shared so many beautiful moments. Arya was sailing west, heading for a new world and new adventures. And Bran was in King’s Landing, ruling the six Kingdoms in desperate need for a long time of peace.

But a smile appeared on her face when she locked her blue eyes with a familiar pair of brown ones.

He wore a simple black uniform and his hair was shorter now than it used to be and yet he still looked like the King he still was deep down. He had his fingers curled around the hilt of his sword, just above the head of the white wolf. Behind him stood the real white wolf with the bright red eyes who never left his side, just in case. Just like everyone else he kneeled down on the cold floor when she walked past him.

Jon wasn’t supposed to be here. He was supposed to be at castle Black or even further beyond the wall. But the only ones who knew that he was here, were the ones who had gathered outside the gates of King’s Landing to free him from his dungeons with violence and death when necessary. And the only ones who truly cared about his punishment, were far away from Winterfell and would most likely never bother to come and check.

With the smile still on her face she turned around to face the crowd while standing in front of the throne. In front of her throne. And the entire room went deafening quiet while Jon stepped forward and put his sword away.

“I hereby declare Sansa of house Stark the only true Queen in the North!” Someone gave him the newly crafted crown and carefully he placed the dire wolf on her bright red hair.

The crown was surprisingly comfortable and the weight of it on her head only made her more determined to give all those people who had fought so hard for her father, for Robb, for Jon and for her what they deserved. She would give them independence, strength and courage. She would make sure they would never have to kneel and crawl again. And she would never let anyone belittle or harass them ever again.

“Long live the Queen in the North whose name is Stark!” The Bannermen rose back to their feet and lifted their swords up. And over and over they repeated the same sentence. “Queen in the North. Queen in the North. Queen in the North.”

Sansa lifted her skirt up a little and sat down on the throne. She felt Jon’s comforting hands resting on her shoulders and while the chanting continued he pressed a soft kiss on her long raid hair.

“You’ll be an amazing Queen, Sansa.” Jon whispered.

“You would have been a great King too, Jon.” Sansa whispered back, but Jon shrugged and kneeled down next to her throne.

“I never really wanted to command or rule.” He placed a finger on her lips when she wanted to interrupt him. “I know you think I’m good at it, but trust me, you’re much better at it. You’re the best that could ever happen to the North.” He leaned a little closer towards her until his stubbled cheek touched her skin. “And while you’ll rule, I’ll take care of our kids.”

The smile on Sansa’s face brightened. She already knew he was gonna be good at that too. And even though she probably could have made it on her own, she was glad she didn’t have to.

blog.description: Film student | 20 | She/Her | My Ao3 | Fanart | Inbox always open | DO NOT GO GENTLE INTO THAT [LONG] NIGHT | Anti GoT |

summary: hey Juliana! I hope this week holds something amazing in it for you. Do you have any character headcanons for any of your favs?...
question: hey Juliana! I hope this week holds something amazing in it for you. Do you have any character headcanons for any of your favs? Thanks! - Alysanne
answer:
Hello! Sorry for taking so long to answer Alysanne!

I have a ton of headcanons!! but it depends which mood you’re in for haha. Sweet? dark? crack? canon or AU headcanons lol? 

Future book speculation/wistful headcanons include Arya and Dany passionately racing their horses against each other at Winterfell, Sansa warging into birds, Jon feeling the most emotional stirring after his resurrection when he sees dragons for the first time, Gendry or Mya being legitimized, Brienne returning Oathkeeper/ICE (maybe Jaime?) to the Starklings, Rickon growing up to look like Robb, Bran ruling from the isle of face, Balerion and Ser Pounce surviving KL somehow, etc etc etc 

kinda-Sad to really-sad future headcanons include Daenerys sobbing in solitude questioning everything after her Red Keep dragonfire accidentally burns all Wildfire cashes and Kings Landing into ashes, Rickon thinking Sansa is his mother, Jon and Dany planning a future together (even if it can’t happen :c ), Jon visiting Lyanna’s crypt every night, Jon mourning for the half-siblings he never met, Arya raising Jon and Dany’s kid as Ned raised Lyanna’s etc etc etc

Wild but “not-impossible-hear-me-out-man” headcanons include “the man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. If you would take a man’s life, you owe it to him to look into his eyes and hear his final words. And if you cannot bear to do that, then perhaps the man does not deserve to die” AKA ruling lady Sansa Stark invents the guillotine ASJDLKASJDASLKDJA

blog.title: Another Arya Stark Stan
blog.description: Just a girl who is obsessed with many things: Star Wars, Game of Thrones, Harry Potter, Bones, Pitch Perfect, La La Land, Desperate Housewives, Stranger Things, Friends, HIMYM, Orange Is The New Black, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel, The Hunger Games. Cheese addict. Dog lover. Disney and Pixar crazy fan. Pretty decent cook. 🇲🇽. Proud Gryffindor. Broadway Freak. Drummer. I write stuff, mostly fanfiction. Rey Solo theorist. I love all sports. Main ships: Booth & Brennan, Gendrya, Ross & Rachel, Jeca, Everlark, Merder, Mileven, Damerey, Harmione. I have a slightly unhealthy obsession with Julie Andrews and I love John Williams beyond all things. Current state: waiting for Stranger Things 3.

summary: Tag yourself: Game of Thrones characters as members of a school project edition.
body:
Tag yourself: Game of Thrones characters as members of a school project edition.

Arya: you show up in the end when it seems everything is lost and no one has any idea of what to do, and you fix everything in ten seconds. Everyone congratulates you but you refuse to take the credit.

Daenerys: you contribute a great deal to the project but because your teammates hate you they choose to ignore what you did and tell the teacher you did nothing. Somehow you end up failing the class.

Tyrion: you pride yourself in being the smartest of the group but your team gets stucked with a topic you know nothing about and you are forced to remain quiet and watch from the sidelines.

Jon: a straight As student, you pressure your teammates to get the work done to the point you annoy them. You call them, text them and chase them around until they listen to you.

Sansa: you are a bit useless but you give moral support. You contribute with the bare minimal but somehow the teacher awards you with an extra point at the end of the presentation.

The Hound: you hate team work and spend the entire time complaining about how stupid your teammates are. Still you do your thing because you don’t want to fail.

Bran: you are in risk of failing the class so the team makes it their mission to save you. There’s a chance everyone will fail because of you but you do nothing to stop them or to save yourself.

Cersei: you pay someone else to do your part of the work while you fool around with your current boyfriend or girlfriend. You are a little shit and don’t care about your teammates, you only care about your own grade.

Theon: you feel guilty because you convinced your friend to skip a lot of classes and now they need an A+ to pass. You try to make it up to them even if that means failing yourself.

Beric: when one of your classmates freezes and forgets what they were supposed to say during the presentation you step forward and save them. Not all heros wear capes.

Tormund: you crack inappropiate jokes mid-work and distract everyone, also you smuggle alcohol into the team gatherings. No one things you will pass but during the presentation you are one of the best.

Gendry: when they asked you to be part of the team you had no idea what you were getting yourself into but you accepted anyway. You are a good element and get rewarded for your help.

Brienne: you had a plan of what the team was supposed to do but you end up feeling overwhelmed because you underestimated how much work you had to do. Still you get an A for effort.

Jaime: the good-hearted jock. You chose to split from your bestie because you want a good grade to get into a nice college. However, after you pass you go back to your old ways.

Podrick: you didn’t know shit about your team’s topic but somehow learned everything five minutes before the presentation. Everyone likes you because you are hard working.

Jorah: you are loyal to your friends and if you fail at least you will fail together. It sucks because you are a good student and you almost passed but you got distracted for a second.

Lyanna: you are a new student and you don’t know as much as your teammates but you do something amazing at the presentation and impress the teacher.

Melisandre: you spend most team gatherings talking shit and getting everyone into trouble but you had one brilliant idea that is crutial to the team’s success. You are a good motivator and you change schools a lot.

Ghost: you are a very important part of the team but for some reason no one seems to notice it and they never congratulate you. However you still get the work done and never fail.

The Night King: overconfident, you brag about being the teacher’s favorite and you don’t prepare for the presentation. They kick you out of the team because you suck.

tags: people like sAnSa IsNt A wArG
summary: All of the Stark children are wargs, including Sansa Stark.   Bran, Arya, and Jon are the obvious wargs based off their dreams....
body:
All of the Stark children are wargs, including Sansa Stark. 

Bran, Arya, and Jon are the obvious wargs based off their dreams. Robb and Rickon are the less obvious wargs because they don’t have povs, but you can tell based off how people describe their actions and the actions of their direwolves. (Like Robb becoming a wolf in battle or Rickon and Shaggy Dog both acting feral or wild.) Sansa is the only Stark child that doesn’t really have any sort of indication she is warging. But you know what she also doesn’t have that the others do? A direwolf.

All the Stark children are deeply, soulfully connected to their wolves. Their wolves are the first thing any of them warg into. It’s only after they’ve been warging into their wolves for a while that they move on to other animals (like cats or birds). All of the Starks still have their direwolves accept for Sansa (Robb died with Grey Wind and Shaggy Dog, Ghost, Summer and Nymeria are all still alive). She lost Lady at an incredibly young age back before her life went to shit. (The kids only seemed to Stark warging after their lives became stressful and life-or-death, that must have triggered it for them.)

I’m entirely confident if Lady was still alive Sansa would be having wolf dreams as well. But she lost her connection. This is why the direwolves are so essential to this story and to the Stark children - it’s their connection to magic and Sansa lost hers.
